name: p-chlorophenol
source: Aldrich Chemical Company; Aldrich Catalog-Handbook of Fine Chemicals; Milwaukee; WI; 1984.
Reason: 1,1'-propanediol base has a melting point around 50 degrees Celsius. The basic unit we can compare to is 1,1'-propanediol, which has a melting point around 50 degrees Celsius. The additional functionalities and structural features in p-chlorophenol will affect its melting point: (1) The chlorine atom introduces a strong withdrawing group, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +5 degrees Celsius.
